key_channel_insights.line_content: OTA prices are higher than Pegasus Airlines' website 82.85% of the time, with only 0.55% instances of lower pricing, indicating a significant markup tendency.
67.54% of MSE itineraries are priced higher than on Pegasus Airlines' website, with a consistent pricing pattern across short and long-haul flights.
GDS channel predominantly shows higher pricing, with 98.97% of fares above those on Pegasus Airlines' website, illustrating a strong markup practice.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: In overall comparisons, OTA prices were higher than the airline website 82.85% of the time last week, indicating a consistent markup in the OTA channel pricing.
OTA prices were lower only 0.55% of the time, suggesting rare instances of OTAs offering competitive discounts compared to the airline's website.
Price discrepancies have shown relative stability over different periods, with minor fluctuations influenced mostly by OTA mark-up practices.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Airline's offers were not available on OTAs 14.34% of the time last week, showing a slight increase compared to the previous week.
82.85% of OTA prices were higher than on the airline's website last week, showing a slight decline from the previous week's 84.61%.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: For short-haul flights, OTAs were priced higher 82.38% of the time, maintaining a consistent premium compared to the airline's website.
For long-haul flights, OTA's higher pricing frequency of 87.98% increased by 8.38% compared to the previous month, highlighting increasing pricing discrepancies on this route.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_title: TR Origins Show OTA Higher Pricing
ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: From Turkish origins, OTAs priced higher 89.76% of the time, reflecting a stable pattern in marked-up pricing.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_title: Non-TR Origins Indicate High OTA Discrepancy
ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: From non-Turkish points of origin, OTA higher pricing rose to 64.29% with an 11.32% monthly increase, demonstrating a growing discrepancy.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_title: Close-In Bookings Prone to Higher Pricing
ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: For close-in booking windows, OTAs were higher 83.29% of the time last week, showing OTAs capitalize on urgency for higher markups.
Far-out bookings had OTA higher pricing 81.92% of the time, a decrease from the previous month, indicating occasional competitive pricing in the long-term booking window.

mse_highlights.line_title: High Percentage of Higher Prices on MSE
mse_highlights.line_content: In the MSE channel, 67.54% of all itineraries were priced higher than on the carrier's website last week, with a consistent trend in both short and long-haul.
Only 8.56% of itineraries were priced lower on MSE compared to the airline website last week, reflecting a declining trend over the previous month.
Pricing remains stable where MSE prices match the airline's website, with a consistency seeing only slight fluctuations of less than 1% over the weeks.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: The frequency of cases where offers were unavailable on MSE decreased slightly by 0.57% from the previous week but increased 8.88% from the last month, indicating a potential consistency improvement by monthly comparison.
A significant portion, over 67% of cases, saw higher prices on MSE compared to the airline's website, with negligible changes in the short term but a 4.23% increase from the past month.

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: Short-haul itineraries continue to show a high frequency of 67.44% for MSE higher prices, slightly decreasing from the previous week.

mse_summary_by_region.line_title: Long Haul Sees Higher Price Increase
mse_summary_by_region.line_content: Long-haul itineraries increased in MSE higher prices with a 15.06% rise over the past month, signaling a growing pricing strategy disparity for these routes.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_title: High MSE Pricing in TR Markets
mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: For TR point of origin, 67.76% of cases saw MSE offering higher prices than the airline's website. This is a key area to address as it signals consistent market discrepancies.
In Non-TR markets, 66.94% of routes priced higher on MSE increased significantly from last month, highlighting potential market inefficiencies or opportunities.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Close-in booking window still sees high MSE prices 67.85% of the time, with a slight consistency over weeks, indicating short-term demand effects.
The 'Far Out' booking window indicated relatively stable high MSE pricing at 66.84%, but with a slight decrease from the previous week, possibly due to booking demand corrections.

gds_highlights.line_content: For last week, 98.97% of itineraries analyzed were priced higher in the GDS channel compared to Pegasus Airlines' website.
The GDS channel consistently shows elevated prices across the analyzed weeks, with slight positive price changes, notably a 0.21% increase from the previous week.
Negligible instances of lower GDS pricing, only 0.10% of the cases, with discounts slightly increasing to 0.25% below website pricing over the past month.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: The proportion of GDS unavailability slightly dropped by 0.21% from last week, presenting minor fluctuations as compared to the previous month.
GDS prices were predominantly higher, increasing by 0.54% when compared with the previous month.

gds_summary_by_region.line_content: Short haul flights predominantly exhibited higher GDS pricing with a marked higher incidence of 2.40% last week.
Long haul showed less frequent GDS availability, but consistently reflected higher GDS pricing, while offering marginal decrease in price trends by 0.12% over the previous month.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Domestic routes in Turkey had 99.25% higher GDS pricing with only minor declines in percentage price differences, maintaining a notable 2.86% average GDS premium.
Non-Turkey origins experienced slightly more GDS lower offerings, but still maintained a dominant proportion of higher GDS prices, with a slight downward trend in average differences over the month.

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Close in bookings continue to uphold a GDS higher pricing structure, with last week showing a 2.34% premium in this channel.
Far out bookings revealed a reducing trend in GDS price differences, with recent increases slightly tempered by a notable frequency drop compared to last month.
